channel.title: SMF password encryption
channel.description:
I'm writing a PHP script that creates an SMF (2.0 Beta) account but don't understand the password encryption - md5, md5_hmac and salt. I've been researching it for a while and read Register.php but whenever it seems to make sense and should work, it doesn't.
Am I right in generating a random 4 character string to insert into the salt field, or is the salt generated from something else? I've tried many things, using the username password and salt but just don't get it. If anyone knows how it works, can you explain or post a sample on how to generate the passwd field?

item.title: SMF password encryption
item.dc:creator: @_freesecks _freesecks
item.description:
@_freesecks wrote:

[quote=“Orange Man, post:5, topic:252900”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=334075.msg2604395#msg2604395 date=1230448710]
the encryption is sha1($PASS);
[/quote]

Got it working: sha1(strtolower($user) . $pass)

For some reason it works without salt… oh well.[/quote]
(strtolower($user) . $pass)

That is the salt.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 05, 2009, 03:00:07 am[/size][hr][quote=“Pwnd, post:7, topic:252900”][quote author=_freesecks link=topic=334075.msg2617593#msg2617593 date=1231132683]

the encryption is sha1($PASS);

orly?
i couldve sworn it was pass+user
[/quote]Read all of the posts, maybe.[/quote]
Oops.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF password encryption
item.dc:creator: @Orange_Man Orange Man
item.description:
@Orange_Man wrote:

Ohh that looks better xD

so sha1($pass.$salt) ?

–
Got it working: sha1(strtolower($user) . $pass)

For some reason it works without salt… oh well.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF password encryption
item.dc:creator: @Orange_Man Orange Man
item.description:
@Orange_Man wrote:

Suppose it’s not really allowed, but it’s not like I’m asking for a special mod or anything - just how to do the encryption. I might post on SMF later if I don’t resolve this…

I didn’t know that they have an SSI function for this, but even if they do I doubt it’ll be stripped down enough for what I want to do.

I’m just doing this to create a new member:
INSERT INTO smf_members
(id_member, member_name, date_registered, posts, id_group, last_login, real_name, instant_messages, unread_messages, new_pm, pm_prefs, passwd, gender, birthdate, hide_email, show_online, time_offset, pm_email_notify, karma_bad, karma_good, notify_announcements, notify_regularity, notify_send_body, notify_types, member_ip, member_ip2, id_theme, is_activated, id_post_group, total_time_logged_in, password_salt, warning, karma_disabled, referrals_no, referrals_hits, referred_by, referred_on) VALUES
("$id_member", “$member_name”, “$date_registered”, “$posts”, “$id_group”, “$last_login”, “$real_name”, “$instant_messages”, “$unread_messages”, “$new_pm”, “$pm_prefs”, “$passwd”, “$gender”, “$birthdate”, “$hide_email”, “$show_online”, “$time_offset”, “$pm_email_notify”, “$karma_bad”, “$karma_good”, “$notify_announcements”, “$notify_regularity”, “$notify_send_body”, “$notify_types”, “$member_ip”, “$member_ip2”, “$id_theme”, “$is_activated”, “$id_post_group”, “$total_time_logged_in”, “$password_salt”, “$warning”, “$karma_disabled”, “$referrals_no”, “$referrals_hits”, “$referred_by”, “$referred_on”)

Got everything working except the password:
md5(md5_hmac($_REQUEST[“password”], $_REQUEST[“username”]) . $salt)
or
md5_hmac($_REQUEST[“password”], strtolower($_REQUEST[“username”]))

using:
function md5_hmac($data, $key)
{
$key = str_pad(strlen($key) <= 64 ? $key : pack(‘H*’, md5($key)), 64, chr(0x00));
return md5(($key ^ str_repeat(chr(0x5c), 64)) . pack(‘H*’, md5(($key ^ str_repeat(chr(0x36), 64)). $data)));
}

Read full topic
